overall_summary: The reasoning employs a practical approach focused on daily pattern extraction due to limited historical data (4 days). It emphasizes handling data constraints through simple averaging methods while acknowledging limitations in detecting weekly seasonality or trends. The analysis shows moderate complexity with clear prioritization of implementable solutions over theoretical optimality.
key_insights: Data length (4 days) limits detection of weekly seasonality/trends
Hourly averaging as a fallback for unstable daily seasonality
Explicit rounding strategy matching source data precision
Assumption of pattern stability for multi-day forecasting
Rejection of complex models (SARIMA/ETS) due to insufficient training data
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with thorough evaluation of statistical methods, detailed pattern analysis, and operational simplifications. Combines theoretical considerations (seasonality detection) with practical implementation constraints (data length, rounding requirements).
